Module yae.audio

Handles creating, playing and manipulating sound and music instances.

Sound effects are small audio samples, usually no longer than a few seconds, that are played back on specific game events such as a character jumping or shooting a gun. For any sound that's longer than a few seconds it is preferable to stream it from disk instead of fully loading it into RAM. Yae provides a "stream" source that lets you do that.

Yae supports MP3, OGG and WAV files. note1: iOS currently does not support OGG files. note2: On Android, a static source cannot be over 1 MB

Functions

getSourceCount () Gets the current number of simultaneously playing sources.
getVolume () Returns the master volume.
newSource (filename[, audiotype="stream"[, filetype="internal"]]) Creates a new Source from a filepath.
pause (source) Pause the specified Source.
play (source) Plays the specified Source.
resume (source) Resumes the specified paused Source.
setVolume (volume) Sets the master volume.
stop (source) This function will only stop the specified Source.
stopAll () This function will stop all currently active sources.


Functions

getSourceCount ()
Gets the current number of simultaneously playing sources.

Returns:

    number The current number of simultaneously playing sources.

Usage:

    numSources = yae.audio.getSourcesCount!
getVolume ()
Returns the master volume.

Returns:

    number The current master volume

Usage:

    volume = yae.audio.getVolume!
newSource (filename[, audiotype="stream"[, filetype="internal"]])
Creates a new Source from a filepath.

Parameters:

  • filename string The name (and path) of the file.
  • audiotype string Type of the audio. (default "stream")
  • filetype string Type of the file (default "internal")

Returns:

    Source A new Source that can play the specified audio.

See also:

    yae.Source.new

Usage:

    source = yae.audio.newSource filename, audiotype, filetype
pause (source)
Pause the specified Source.

Parameters:

  • source Source The Source on which to pause the playback

Usage:

    yae.audio.pause source
play (source)
Plays the specified Source.

Parameters:

  • source Source The Source to play.

Usage:

    yae.audio.play source
resume (source)
Resumes the specified paused Source.

Parameters:

  • source Source The Source to resume

Usage:

    yae.audio.resume source
setVolume (volume)
Sets the master volume.

Parameters:

  • volume number 1.0 is max and 0.0 is off.

Usage:

    yae.audio.setVolume volume
stop (source)
This function will only stop the specified Source.

Parameters:

  • source Source The Source on which to stop the playback.

Usage:

    yae.audio.stop source
stopAll ()
This function will stop all currently active sources.

Usage:

    yae.audio.stopAll!
